content:
I’m a second-year Electronics and Computer Engineering undergraduate student at Thapar University, Patiala. I am generally interested in deep learning algorithms for computer vision. I have been involved in the development of projects on Image classification, Semantic segmentation, Instance Segmentation, and Instance Recognition. I love to actively contribute in OpenSource and take part in kaggle competitions.
I’m also working as a part-time Research Engineer at a startup Minus Zero in which I’m working on an autonomous electric car with level 5 autonomy. I was fortunate to spend my winters in 2020 at the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, where I was supervised by Dr. Mohammed Javed. My research interest includes hand-pose estimation, road segmentation, and scene-text detection.

I have been involved in the development of projects on Image classification, Semantic segmentation, Instance Segmentation, and Instance Recognition.
title: Animesh Gupta

summary: Developed a GAN that generates 7,000 to 10,000 Monet-style images.
title: I’m Something of a Painter Myself

summary: Developed a classification model for predicting seven emotions like (angry, disgusted,fearful, happy, neutral, sad and surprised) using FER-2013 dataset.
title: AI for Blind

summary: Developed a classification model for predicting landmark labels using the GLDv2 dataset.
title: Google Landmark Recognition 2020

summary: "Programmer” is more closely associated with “man” and “homemaker” is more closely associated with “woman”.  Such gender bias has also been shown to propagate in downstream tasks.
title: Double-Hard Debias: Tailoring Word Embeddings for Gender Bias Mitigation
